meanings.definition: The study of the processes of decay and fossilization in organisms.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use taphonomies to understand how living things turn into fossils.
meanings.sent2: In taphonomies, researchers investigate how plants and animals become preserved over time.
meanings.sent3: The taphonomies class was so interesting that even the rocks seemed to listen.
meanings.sent4: Her room, filled with old books and dusty artifacts, was a taphonomies laboratory of the past.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit on taphonomies brought to life the ancient world of creatures turning into stone.

meanings.definition: The analysis of burial practices and their effects on the preservation of remains.
meanings.sent1: Archaeologists rely on taphonomies to study how different burials impact the decay of bodies.
meanings.sent2: Taphonomies help us understand how burial traditions influence the condition of skeletons.
meanings.sent3: At the quirky funeral, the comedian joked about the taphonomies of ancient civilizations.
meanings.sent4: The graveyard at night took on an eerie taphonomies aura, as if the dead whispered secrets.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the taphonomies of a forgotten cemetery, where history lay undisturbed.
